attributes.action: Re-open doctors surgeries fully, to enable patients to be seen by GPs
attributes.additional_details: The fundamental part of being a GP is to provide a physical examination to make an informed diagnosis.  With the continual lifting of restrictions allowing people to have personal contact (eg dentists/hairdressers) then it is imperative that we are now allowed to physically see our GP.  Patients can find it extremely difficult to convey their symptoms via telephone & lots of older/vulnerable people find it difficult/unable to communicate via Zoom type consultations.  We need to see our doctors
attributes.background: Issue an instruction to all the General Practitioners in England  to resume surgeries and provide face to face consultations immediately

rejection.details:
Decisions on when to offer a face to face, as opposed to a remote, consultation are an operational decision for GPs and NHS Trusts.

Find out more:
https://www.rcgp.org.uk/covid-19/general-practice-is-open.aspx
